feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The transcript demonstrates a functioning financial application: it ingests transaction CSVs, computes a financial health score and totals, produces category breakdowns and budget recommendations, and outputs a 90-day plan (Implement evidence). The student explicitly framed the project via the DRIVER loops (Discover/Reflect), and the detailed output examples support a thorough, working financial tool, meeting PASS criteria.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates concrete AI integration (Google AI Studio/Gemini) that ingests transaction CSVs, categorizes data, generates analytics, visuals, and personalized recommendations — iteratively improved across driver loops. This shows AI adds substantive value beyond a superficial feature, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So here we just got our fin therapy report where our health score, financial health score in this case is 45 on 100. It tells us how much we spent this much, so $4,883. It breaks it down into essential expenses..."
"I thought about it in terms of the driver framework where I was like okay I want to obviously have a financial health advisor tool that will take in input of your current state of finances..."

"So it's the compassionate financial diagnosis, where just uploading your spending data that you have will analyze your behavioral patterns, protect the credit score, as well as give you a 90-day transformation plan to improve your spending and financial habits."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover (defined goal to build an intelligent finance tool), Implement (built in Google AI Studio, uploads CSV and generates reports/graphs), Reflect (discusses driver framework and project outcomes) — these stages show conception, construction, and evaluation of a working financial app.
criteria.reasoning: The transcript demonstrates a functioning financial application: it ingests transaction CSVs, computes a financial health score and totals, produces category breakdowns and budget recommendations, and outputs a 90-day plan (Implement evidence). The student explicitly framed the project via the DRIVER loops (Discover/Reflect), and the detailed output examples support a thorough, working financial tool, meeting PASS criteria.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "here is my app. It's fully built by Google AI Studio."

"That was my first driver loop where I made a very simple, basic app with Google AIS Studio. And then when I went through my second driver loop, I started adding in, you know, like graphs and diagrams... And then for the third driver loop, I improved it by actually taking into consideration the psychology of the spender and behavioral habits..."

"It analyzes our current spending patterns in the data sheet that we give it. It explains our spending psychology, our habits, and how much we're spending on each item in our budget. And then it also advises us on the financial decisions of what to do in our next steps or 90 day transformation..."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Implement — built and ran the app in Google AI Studio, processed CSV input, produced analyses and visualizations.  
Discover — framed project goal to build intelligent finance tools that use AI.  
Reflect — iterated through driver loops and evaluated AI (Gemini API) effectiveness.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates concrete AI integration (Google AI Studio/Gemini) that ingests transaction CSVs, categorizes data, generates analytics, visuals, and personalized recommendations — iteratively improved across driver loops. This shows AI adds substantive value beyond a superficial feature, meeting the PASS standard.
